item.title: Research Finds Dressmakers Have Good Eyes, And Not Just For Style
item.description: June 16, 2017 - In a study of people from a variety of professions, dressmakers were found to have superior 3-D vision. Could their endless hours of delicate handwork be honing eyesight?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 16, 2017 - In a study of people from a variety of professions, dressmakers were found to have superior 3-D vision. Could their endless hours of delicate handwork be honing eyesight? http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/16/532936445/research-finds-dressmakers-have-good-eyes-and-not-just-for-style

item.title: Doctor Who Wrote 1980 Letter On Painkillers Regrets That It Fed The Opioid Crisis
item.description: June 16, 2017 - In 1980, Dr. Hershel Jick wrote a one-paragraph letter about low rates of addiction among hospitalized patients given narcotics. It was later cited as evidence that long-term opioid use was safe.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 16, 2017 - In 1980, Dr. Hershel Jick wrote a one-paragraph letter about low rates of addiction among hospitalized patients given narcotics. It was later cited as evidence that long-term opioid use was safe. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/16/533060031/doctor-who-wrote-1980-letter-on-painkillers-regrets-that-it-fed-the-opioid-crisi

item.title: Lead Detected In Baby Food Samples. Pediatricians Say There's No Safe Level
item.description: June 15, 2017 - Twenty percent of baby food samples were found to contain lead, according to a report from the Environmental Defense Fund. Pediatricians say there's no safe lead level. FDA is reviewing its policy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 2017 - Twenty percent of baby food samples were found to contain lead, according to a report from the Environmental Defense Fund. Pediatricians say there's no safe lead level. FDA is reviewing its policy. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/15/533103892/lead-detected-in-baby-food-samples-pediatricians-say-theres-no-safe-level

item.title: The Roots Of Consciousness: We're Of Two Minds
item.description: June 15, 2017 - Surgery that severs the link between brain hemispheres reveals that those halves have way different views of the world. We ask a pioneering scientist what that tells us about human consciousness.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 2017 - Surgery that severs the link between brain hemispheres reveals that those halves have way different views of the world. We ask a pioneering scientist what that tells us about human consciousness. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/15/532920899/the-roots-of-consciousness-were-of-two-minds

item.title: A Few Genetic Tweaks To Chinese Bird Flu Virus Could Fuel A Human Pandemic
item.description: June 15, 2017 - Three genetic changes could be enough to make a bird flu strain that's already killing some people in China highly contagious. Are experiments with a deliberately mutated version too risky?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 2017 - Three genetic changes could be enough to make a bird flu strain that's already killing some people in China highly contagious. Are experiments with a deliberately mutated version too risky? http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/15/532925945/just-small-genetic-tweaks-to-chinese-bird-flu-virus-could-fuel-a-human-pandemic

item.title: Teens' Use Of E-Cigarettes Drops For The First Time, CDC Says
item.description: June 15, 2017 - Public education campaigns and restrictions on sales to minors have helped discourage teenagers from vaping, according to officials at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 2017 - Public education campaigns and restrictions on sales to minors have helped discourage teenagers from vaping, according to officials at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/15/533062545/teens-use-of-e-cigarettes-drops-for-the-first-time-cdc-says

item.title: About Us: Goats And Soda
item.description:
June 15, 2017 - Goats and Soda: What's our mission? And what's behind our name?
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/15/527593730/about-us-goats-and-soda
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: 'Supersizing Urban America': How U.S. Policies Encouraged Fast Food To Spread
item.description: June 15, 2017 - A new book examines how federal government policies made it easier for minorities to open fast-food franchises than grocery stores. Today the landscape of urban America reflects this history.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 2017 - A new book examines how federal government policies made it easier for minorities to open fast-food franchises than grocery stores. Today the landscape of urban America reflects this history. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/15/527044693/-supersizing-urban-america-how-u-s-policies-encouraged-fast-food-to-spread

item.title: Medicaid Cuts In Wisconsin Would Undermine Training For Adults With Disabilities
item.description: June 14, 2017 - Job-coaching and other support services that enable many adults to live in the community instead of institutions will likely be curtailed if the GOP plan to shrink Medicaid becomes law.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 14, 2017 - Job-coaching and other support services that enable many adults to live in the community instead of institutions will likely be curtailed if the GOP plan to shrink Medicaid becomes law. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/14/531928586/medicaid-cuts-in-wisconsin-would-undermine-training-for-adults-with-disabilities

item.title: In Texas, People With Fluctuating Incomes Risk Being Cut Off From Medicaid
item.description: June 14, 2017 - Families with income that varies from month to month can find it hard to maintain enrollment in Texas' Medicaid program. The question is whether the program trims waste or creates more red tape.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 14, 2017 - Families with income that varies from month to month can find it hard to maintain enrollment in Texas' Medicaid program. The question is whether the program trims waste or creates more red tape. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/14/532816157/in-texas-people-with-fluctuating-incomes-risk-being-cut-off-from-medicaid

item.title: Trump Administration Gives Industry More Time to Adopt New Nutrition Fact Label
item.description: June 13, 2017 - The Nutrition Facts label on food and drink packaging has gotten a makeover, but you may not see the updates for a while. The FDA has delayed the compliance date after companies asked for more time.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - The Nutrition Facts label on food and drink packaging has gotten a makeover, but you may not see the updates for a while. The FDA has delayed the compliance date after companies asked for more time. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/13/532819225/trump-administration-gives-industry-more-time-to-adopt-new-nutrition-fact-label

item.title: Nevada May Become First State To Offer Medicaid To All, Regardless Of Income
item.description: June 13, 2017 - The Nevada legislature has passed a bill that would allow anyone without health insurance in the state to buy into the Medicaid program, regardless of income. It's awaiting the governor's signature.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - The Nevada legislature has passed a bill that would allow anyone without health insurance in the state to buy into the Medicaid program, regardless of income. It's awaiting the governor's signature. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/13/532783189/nevada-may-become-first-state-to-offer-medicaid-to-all-regardless-of-income

item.title: Brain Cell Transplants Are Being Tested Once Again For Parkinson's
item.description: June 13, 2017 - In 2003, researchers declared a moratorium on the use of transplanted brain cells to treat Parkinson's disease. Now, armed with better cells, they're giving the approach another try.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - In 2003, researchers declared a moratorium on the use of transplanted brain cells to treat Parkinson's disease. Now, armed with better cells, they're giving the approach another try. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/13/532792500/brain-cell-transplants-are-being-tested-once-again-for-parkinsons

item.title: Long Waits And Long Odds For Those Who Need Social Security Disability
item.description: June 13, 2017 - The U.S. government has been struggling to balance a surge in applicants for disability benefits with shrinking funds. An updated application process could make getting benefits even harder.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - The U.S. government has been struggling to balance a surge in applicants for disability benefits with shrinking funds. An updated application process could make getting benefits even harder. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/13/531207430/people-with-unseen-disabilities-could-suffer-under-new-government-rules

item.title: What's The Difference Between Famine And Hunger? A Food FAQ
item.description: June 13, 2017 - We asked our readers what they wanted to know about world hunger? So many thoughtful questions came in that we did a roundup of queries about hunger and famine.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - We asked our readers what they wanted to know about world hunger? So many thoughtful questions came in that we did a roundup of queries about hunger and famine. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/13/532277316/what-s-the-difference-between-famine-and-hunger-a-food-faq
